statement: You are given two positive integers x and y (1â‰¤ x, yâ‰¤ 10^9).Find a non-negative integer kâ‰¤ 10^{18}, such that (x+k) + (y+k) = (x+k)\oplus (y+k) holds^{\text{âˆ—}}, or determine that such an integer does not exist.^{\text{âˆ—}}\oplus denotes the bitwise XOR operation.

output_specification: OutputFor each test case, output a single integer k (0â‰¤ kâ‰¤ 10^{18}) â€” the integer you found. Print -1 if it is impossible to find such an integer.If there are multiple answers, you may print any of them.
